xsens::SharedPointer< T > Class Template Reference

A template class that contains a reference counted pointer. More...

Public Member Functions

 SharedPointer ()
 Null-pointer constructor.
 
 SharedPointer (const SharedPointer &p)
 Copy constructor, adds a reference to the stored object.
 
 SharedPointer (T *p)
 Constructor, takes ownership of the pointer and sets the reference count to 1.
 
 ~SharedPointer ()
 Destructor, dereferences the stored data. If the reference count hits 0, the data is deleted.
 
const T * operator() () const
 Return a const pointer to the data. This does not detach/copy the data.
 
T * operator() ()
 Return a mutable pointer to the data. This detaches/copies the data if the reference count is greater than 1.
 
SharedPointer & operator= (const SharedPointer &p)
 Copy the reference from one SharedDataPointer to another.

Detailed Description

template<typename T>
class xsens::SharedPointer< T >

A template class that contains a reference counted pointer.

The SharedDataPointer class implements implicit sharing and is inspired on QSharedDataPointer. The contained type T should inherit from SharedData and should implement at least a basic constructor and either a copy constructor or a function that allows it to clone itself. In the latter case, a specialized clone() function should be written for the SharedDataPointer class.
